medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic thoracic spine pain and possible malfunction of her intrathecal drug delivery system.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms have been ongoing for an unspecified duration, with the intrathecal pump placed 9 months prior to her visit. She was receiving 40 mg/day of intrathecal morphine and had previously escalated from 10 mg/day due to inadequate pain control.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for depression, anterior cervical discectomy with fusion, and placement of a SynchroMed EL Infusion Pump for chronic pain related to T4 and T5 vertebral hemangiomas.
medical_history.social_history: The patient admitted to self-administering morphine intramuscularly and extracting 1 ml intrathecal morphine, suggesting possible history of substance use.
